text: Bharatiya Jana Sangh was an Indian right wing political party that existed from 1951 to 1977 and was the political arm of Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh, a Hindu nationalist volunteer organisation. Later Jana Sangh succeeded by Bharatiya Janata Party. ==References== Category:Political parties in India Category:1951 establishments in Asia Category:1950s establishments in India Category:1977 disestablishments Category:1970s disestablishments in Asia Category:20th-century disestablishments in India
title: Bharatiya Jana Sangh
